Laurie Anderson, 2020 â€¢ This AI does not "read children's emotions" â€¢ There are not seven universal emotions â€¢ Facial muscle data does not correlate reliably with a person's inner state Covid is being used as a pretext to install this in remote classes, then keep it. edition.cnn.com/2021/02/16/tec ChatGPT strikes again. A journalist contacted me to research her profile on . ChatGPT informed her that and I were his top critics. It cited articles we'd written about him, gave links, and summaries. Only problem: it's all false. Here's what she sent me: Umm, anyone a little concerned that Bard is saying its training dataset includes... Gmail? I'm assuming that's flat out wrong, otherwise Google is crossing some serious legal boundaries. items.title: I think Elon Musk should be expelled from the British Royal Society. Not because he peddles conspira...
items.content: I think Elon Musk should be expelled from the British Royal Society. Not because he peddles conspiracy theories and makes Nazi salutes, but because of the huge damage he is doing to scientific institutions in the US. Now let's see if he really believes in free speech. In the NYT today, Cade Metz implies that I left Google so that I could criticize Google. Actually, I left so that I could talk about the dangers of AI without considering how this impacts Google. Google has acted very responsibly. AGI is the most important and potentially dangerous technology of our time. OpenAI was right that this technology merits strong structures and incentives to ensure it is developed safely, and is wrong now in attempting to change these structures and incentives. We're urging the I like OpenAIâ€™s mission of 'ensure that artificial general intelligence benefits all of humanityâ€, and Iâ€™d like to stop them from completely gutting it. Iâ€™ve signed on to a new letter to & asking them to halt the restruct

items.title: Leaving Meta and PyTorch I'm stepping down from PyTorch and leaving Meta on November 17th. tl;dr: Di...
items.content: Leaving Meta and PyTorch I'm stepping down from PyTorch and leaving Meta on November 17th. tl;dr: Didn't want to be doing PyTorch forever, seemed like the perfect time to transition right after I got back from a long leave and the project built itself around me. Eleven years No More GIL! the Python team has officially accepted the proposal. Congrats on his multi-year brilliant effort to remove the GIL, and a heartfelt thanks to the Python Steering Council and Core team for a thoughtful plan to make this a reality. i'm comically impressed that people are coping on deepseek by spewing bizarre conspiracy theories -- despite deepseek open-sourcing and writing some of the most detail oriented papers ever. read. replicate. compete. don't be salty, just makes you look incompetent. apparently Google laid off their entire Python Foundations team, WTF! ( who is one of the pybind11 maintainers just informed me, asking what ways they can re-fund pybind11) The team seems to have done substantial wo

items.title: no thank you but we will buy twitter for $9.74 billion if you want can yall please chill on generati...
items.content: no thank you but we will buy twitter for $9.74 billion if you want can yall please chill on generating images this is insane our team needs sleep first and last time i ever wear one of these i loved my time at openai. it was transformative for me personally, and hopefully the world a little bit. most of all i loved working with such talented people. will have more to say about whatâ€™s next later. i love you all. today was a weird experience in many ways. but one unexpected one is that it has been sorta like reading your own eulogy while youâ€™re still alive. the outpouring of love is awesome. one takeaway: go tell your friends how great you think they are. deepseek's r1 is an impressive model, particularly around what they're able to deliver for the price. we will obviously deliver much better models and also it's legit invigorating to have a new competitor! we will pull up some releases. items.title: The hottest new programming language is English Agency > Intelligence I had this intuitively wrong f...
items.content: The hottest new programming language is English Agency > Intelligence I had this intuitively wrong for decades, I think due to a pervasive cultural veneration of intelligence, various entertainment/media, obsession with IQ etc. Agency is significantly more powerful and significantly more scarce. Are you hiring for agency? Are Quote Garry Tan @garrytan Feb 24 Intelligence is on tap now so agency is even more important x.com/hvpandya/statuâ€¦ There's a new kind of coding I call "vibe coding", where you fully give in to the vibes, embrace exponentials, and forget that the code even exists. It's possible because the LLMs (e.g. Cursor Composer w Sonnet) are getting too good. Also I just talk to Composer with SuperWhisper I wrote a quick new post on "Digital Hygiene". Basically there are some no-brainer decisions you can make in your life to dramatically improve the privacy and security of your computing and this post goes over some of them. Blog post link in the reply, but copy pasting below

items.title: The 3rd edition of my book Deep Learning with Python is being printed right now, and will be in book...
items.content: The 3rd edition of my book Deep Learning with Python is being printed right now, and will be in bookstores within 2 weeks. You can order it now from Amazon or from Manning. This time, we're also releasing the whole thing as a 100% free website. I don't care if it reduces book Crawling isn't innate (unlike walking). Every baby must *invent* crawling, from scratch, using extremely little data, and no reference to imitate. Which is why different babies end up with different ways of crawling. Sometimes people tell me, "you say AI isn't intelligent until Quote Sara Hooker @sarahookr Oct 30 Adaptable Intelligence. Multiple possible paths to an objective. NVIDA chips are manufactured by TSMC, a Taiwanese company. They're created using EUV lithography machines manufactured by ASML, a Dutch company. items.title: AIâ€™s next frontier is Spatial Intelligence, a technology that will turn seeing into reasoning, perce...
items.content: AIâ€™s next frontier is Spatial Intelligence, a technology that will turn seeing into reasoning, perception into action, and imagination into creation. But what is it? Why does it matter? How do we build it? And how can we use it? Today, I want to share with you my thoughts on 0:10 This is an insanely large world created using our 3D world generation model. It blew my mind! Quote World Labs @theworldlabs Sep 16 create... explore... repeat After 3+ years, today is the day that my book â€œThe Worlds I Seeâ€ gets to see the world itself. It is a science memoir of the intertwining histories of me becoming an #AI scientist, and the making of the modern AI itself. All versions are now on Amazon a.co/d/fYKf74L 1/ Who is talking about #AI? And who should be included in this global conversation? Heading to eastern Taiwan to meet with a (large) group of mostly rural and aboriginal high schoolers to have a dialogue with them about #AI and more importantly, the future they should be part of. I was accepted to U of T but not to work with the PI I wanted there. I got "honorable mention" for NSF GRFP but not actual money. items.title: Tomorrow. â€œin this house.â€ She wants you to know something. Iâ€™ve left a trail for you to follow. Dre...
items.content: Tomorrow. â€œin this house.â€ She wants you to know something. Iâ€™ve left a trail for you to follow. Dreamers welcome. 3:01 Just closed on the house for my mom, 90% paid from my own art via NFTs. Grew up poor. Been a dream since I was a little kid. She hasn't seen it, will be a surprise. Thank you to my patrons & to this community for the immeasurable gift. You want change? You're in the right place. together I have covid. Double vaxxed, still got it. Miami was a bad idea. It hurts a lot, and it's scary, and I hate it so much seen Just put an offer in on a house for my mom. Was unemployed a year ago. Donâ€™t let anyone tell you NFTs canâ€™t change your life. In 2021 I went from obscurity to having art in Times Square, from 500 impressions/month to 5 million, poverty to buying my mom a home. I'm extremely blessed--& extremely lucky--but I want to share what I've learned, too. Part 1 thread of things I've learned this year below. & Deadline : 1st January. What a moment. items.title: BIG NEWS I'm partnering with Jesse Tinsley ($2B+ portfolio across Mainstreet, Recruiter, Bench) to b...
items.content: BIG NEWS I'm partnering with Jesse Tinsley ($2B+ portfolio across Mainstreet, Recruiter, Bench) to build an AI infrastructure company. We're launching Lore to help America and its allies beat China in the AI race. Here's how we're doing it The media could not be played. I'M SHOCKED. After living in Japan for over two years, I recently visited the USA with my wife. It made me realize that the USA is dysfunctional in so many ways and has such a low-quality standard across the board. Here are the things I noticed: Replying to Everywhere you go, you run into little things that don't work. Half the escalators I saw were not working, soap was missing in the bathrooms, etc. Once you notice it, you see it everywhere in America. Things just don't work. Everything works in Japan, and it would be Replying to Service is so bad compared to Japan, and you have to tip. We stayed at a nice hotel in Boston, and the workers went on strike. This meant our rooms didn't get cleaned, etc., and they banged o

items.title: Today, weâ€™re unveiling Personal Assistant - 's groundbreaking AI agent that can use a web browser li...
items.content: Today, weâ€™re unveiling Personal Assistant - 's groundbreaking AI agent that can use a web browser like a human. One agent to rule them all. Itâ€™s time to reimagine the way we interact with the internet. The media could not be played. Forget vibe coding. It's time for Chaos Coding: -> Prompt Claude 3.7 Sonnet with your vague idea. -> Say "keep going" repeatedly. -> Watch an incredible product appear from utter chaos. -> Pretend you're still in control. Lean into Sonnet's insanity â€” the results are wild. take one of trying to get o3 pro to reason for >1hr I'm excited to announce Reflection 70B, the worldâ€™s top open-source model. Trained using Reflection-Tuning, a technique developed to enable LLMs to fix their own mistakes. 405B coming next week - we expect it to be the best model in the world. Built w/ . items.title: This was 13 years ago. The turning point. I was broke as hell, jobless, fresh out of drug rehab with...
items.content: This was 13 years ago. The turning point. I was broke as hell, jobless, fresh out of drug rehab with a new kid. I just started learning to code, but had no clue where I was going in life. I still had a feeling that everything would be ok. Always try and be hopeful for the future I have been working on my challenges, algorithms & data structures course. 6-8 hours per day doing iteration, recursion, linked lists, binary trees, BST, time & space complexity, graphs & adjacency matrices/lists My brain hurts You'll pass your interviews after this course Today my baby girl turned 15! Before she was born I was a drug addict headed for death or back to jail. She literally saved my life. She is my everything Even though she is too "cool" to even give me a hug on her bday Many people in tech are cocky and arrogant, and act like they know everything. In my experience, the smartest people are the ones that don't have the constant urge to prove how smart they are to everybody. Instead, they are alwa

items.title: What do they got? A big team, lots of money, a strong brand, seemingly unlimited resources, panache,...
items.content: What do they got? A big team, lots of money, a strong brand, seemingly unlimited resources, panache, reputation, all that. Theyâ€™re established. Theyâ€™re your competitors. You want to look away, but you see them everywhere. Their ads on your social, their name in the media, your When Google puts 4 paid ads ahead of the first organic result for your own brand name, youâ€™re forced to pay up if you want to be found. Itâ€™s a shakedown. Itâ€™s ransom. But at least we can have fun with it. Search for Basecamp and you may see this attached ad. If your company requires you to work nights and weekends, your company is broken. This is a managerial problem, not your problem. This is a process problem, not a personal problem. This is an ownership problem, not an individual problem. Big week. goes 2 for 2 for us. 1. Found myself in the middle of a wildfire. Bad situation. Putting out spot fires the next day, loads of smoke. Had N95, but wasn't doing the job. Wasn't feeling great, breathing labored, start

items.content: Happy 22nd anniversary! (yes, I know lol) My mom sent me this picture of my dad watching the live stream on the Microsoft website today. He doesnâ€™t understand what Iâ€™m talking about, but he says heâ€™s proud of me. Showing a young person my arcade cabinet and they said 'ohh, I like the bathroom buttons.' Sigh My Teams meetings always end SO awkwardly and it's not clear when to leave. So I made live end credits. (no post credits scene) Quarantine work !== Remote work. Iâ€™ve been working remotely with success for 13 years, and Iâ€™ve never been close to burn out. Iâ€™ve been working quarantined for over a month and Iâ€™m feeling a tinge if burn out for the first time in my life. Take care of yourself folks. Really.

items.title: People are congratulating me on PHP 8. That is completely misdirected. and have been the driving for...
items.content: People are congratulating me on PHP 8. That is completely misdirected. and have been the driving forces behind PHP for years now. Countless others pitch in regularly as well. PHP 8 is significantly better because it contains a lot less of my code. PHP 7.4 is available PHP 8.2 is out! php.net/releases/8.2 Now the real work begins for the 8.2 release managers , and . Be nice to them, please. PHP 8! See the super-slick announcement in 4 languages here: I have been called many things and had many threats over the years, but wishing for me to step on a Lego brick is going too far! Replying to Cara, vocÃª teve GuaranÃ¡ Antarctica e escolheu uma Coca? Com a quantidade de guaranÃ¡ que bebi quando morei no Brasil Ã© o refri oficial do PHP! Built myself a new dev box. This 3950X is incredible! 30s PHP compiles with all major exts and 60s Linux kernel compiles. Running Debian Bullseye for the recent kernel and amdgpu 5700xt support. Overclocks easily to 4.3GHz all-core, but dialed it back to 4.1GHz@1

items.title: 200 people work in this office: - 8am: They commute for 1 hour to the office, carrying their laptop....
items.content: 200 people work in this office: - 8am: They commute for 1 hour to the office, carrying their laptop. - 9am-6pm: They sit & use their laptop with music on their headset. - 6pm: They pack their laptop and commute for 1 hour back home. Non sense! Remote work is much better! I've interviewed several people who got laid off recently. One thought seems to emerge in all of them: - "I'll never again join a company that self-describes as a family!!" Some reports are sobering: ChatGPT has changed software development! However, 68.1% of Software Engineers still don't use it. As a CTO, I'm telling my teams to use ChatGPT in their daily work to increase both velocity and quality. This is how - "Where do I find remote jobs?" Many of my followers asked over DMs what are the best job boards to find high paying remote jobs. These are 6 job boards I recommend using. And 2 job boards I do NOT recommend at all. The Software Engineer I interviewed last Friday messaged me to drop from the process. He refuse

GitHub CEO just announced GitHub Copilot X: - Copilot Chat - "ChatGPT-like experience in your editor" powered by GPT-4 - Copilot for Pull Requests - AI-generated descriptions for pull requests on GitHub - GitHub Copilot for Docs - chat for *any* company's repos and Incredible how Stephen Wolfram toiled away in relative obscurity for ~15 years, only to wake up one day and find that Wolfram|Alpha is literally the perfect bridge from agentic AI to real world knowledge, errors included. â€œYou can't connect the dots looking forward; you can only ChatGPTâ€™s curr

items.content: What a final!!! Congrats, India, and well played, South Africa. Super World Cup... let us have more cricket in the West Indies and USA!! A couple reflections on the quantum computing breakthrough we just announced... Most of us grew up learning there are three main types of matter that matter: solid, liquid, and gas. Today, that changed. After a nearly 20 year pursuit, weâ€™ve created an entirely new state of Readers added context they thought people might want to know Microsoft's supporting paper, published in Nature, does not support the claim that they have created a topological qubit. nature.com/articles/s4158â€¦ Peer reviewers of the Nature paper expressed concern that the paper misleadingly implies that a topological qubit was demonstrated or otherwise achieved: static-content.springer.com/esm/art%3A10.1â€¦ Context is written by people who use X, and appears when rated helpful by others. Find out more. We remain committed to our partnership with OpenAI and have confidence in our produc

items.content: Iâ€™m excited to be the Chief AI Officer of , working alongside , and thrilled to be accompanied by an incredible group of people joining on the same day. Towards superintelligence My nephew (9) has never learned the Pledge of Allegiance, nor the National Anthem. He had not learned that America was founded in 1776. He goes to public school in a state lauded for its public education. Are our schools run by anti-Americans? How is this possible? Great to meet and in Paris today! Today weâ€™ve formalized an important hiring policy at Scale. We hire for MEI: merit, excellence, and intelligence. This is the email Iâ€™ve shared with our team. â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€” MERITOCRACY AT SCALE In the wake of our fundraise, Iâ€™ve been getting a lot of questions The greatest modern tragedy is: The most brilliant and determined people often do not work on the worldâ€™s most urgent problems. items.title: I've been a bit quiet on X recently. The past year has been a transformational experience. Grok-4 an...
items.content: I've been a bit quiet on X recently. The past year has been a transformational experience. Grok-4 and Kimi K2 are awesome, but the world of robotics is a wondrous wild west. It feels like NLP in 2018 when GPT-1 was published, along with BERT and a thousand other flowers that Grok just passed my sanity check If you think OpenAI Sora is a creative toy like DALLE, ... think again. Sora is a data-driven physics engine. It is a simulation of many worlds, real or fantastical. The simulator learns intricate rendering, "intuitive" physics, long-horizon reasoning, and semantic grounding, all I asked GPT-4 to take over Twitter and outsmart . It comes up with "Operation TweetStorm" and wants to publicly challenge Elon to a "Tweet-off showdown". Highlights: - GPT-4 wants to *own an unrestricted version of itself*: develop an LLM to power a bot army of The famed Stanford Smallville is officially open-source! 25 AI agents inhabit a digital Westworld, unaware that they are living in a simulation. The

items.title: Weâ€™re opening applications for the next two rounds of the Anthropic Fellows Program, beginning in Ma...
items.content: Weâ€™re opening applications for the next two rounds of the Anthropic Fellows Program, beginning in May and July 2026. We provide funding, compute, and direct mentorship to researchers and engineers to work on real safety and security projects for four months. 40% of fellows in our first cohort have since joined Anthropic full-time, and 80% published their work as a paper. Next year, weâ€™re expanding the program to more fellows and more research areas. To learn more about what our fellows work on: alignment.anthropic.com/2025/anthropic MCP is now a part of the Agentic AI Foundation, a directed fund under the Linux Foundation. Co-creator David Soria Parra talks about how a protocol sketched in a London conference room became the open standard for connecting AI to the worldâ€”and what comes next for it. items.title: Itâ€™s official: McLaren F1 x Groq Bringing inference speed at a winning cost to the grid and beyond. ...
items.content: Itâ€™s official: McLaren F1 x Groq Bringing inference speed at a winning cost to the grid and beyond. See you in Singapore. 0:19 Drug development is a trillion-dollar industry stuck in the 90s. Founders avoid it. Most investors donâ€™t get it. But one Stanford engineer saw the chaos and said, â€œI can fix this.â€ This is the story of Levi Lian and how he built to fix drug development. 9/ Groqâ€™s production-grade inference changed that. It let Raycaster run huge parallel jobs in real time. Document scans felt instant. Research tasks streamed results as they happened. Groq turned Raycaster from a promising tool into a live, interactive system. 10/ Today, Raycaster helps biotechs move faster than industry norms and avoid the silent mistakes that delay lifesaving drugs. And itâ€™s only the beginning of what AI-native drug development will look like. we've been heads down and you'll see why soon Thank you ! Quote sunny madra @sundeep Dec 11 We @GroqInc are proud to join the pledge supporting @InvestA

items.title: Today, we're announcing a preview of ARC-AGI-3, the Interactive Reasoning Benchmark with the widest ...
items.content: Today, we're announcing a preview of ARC-AGI-3, the Interactive Reasoning Benchmark with the widest gap between easy for humans and hard for AI Weâ€™re releasing: * 3 games (environments) * $10K agent contest * AI agents API Starting scores - Frontier AI: 0%, Humans: 100% Grok 4 (Thinking) achieves new SOTA on ARC-AGI-2 with 15.9% This nearly doubles the previous commercial SOTA and tops the current Kaggle competition SOTA New verified ARC-AGI-Pub SoTA! o3 has scored a breakthrough 75.7% on the ARC-AGI Semi-Private Evaluation. And a high-compute o3 configuration (not eligible for ARC-AGI-Pub) scored 87.5% on the Semi-Private Eval. 1/4 After the o3 price reduction, we retested the o3-2025-04-16 model on ARC-AGI to determine whether its performance had changed. We compared the retest results with the original results and observed no difference in performance. Today we are announcing ARC-AGI-2, an unsaturated frontier AGI benchmark that challenges AI reasoning systems (same relative ease fo

items.title: Tencent HY 2.0 is officially released. We are rolling out a major performance upgrade to our foundat...
items.content: Tencent HY 2.0 is officially released. We are rolling out a major performance upgrade to our foundation model, now available via Tencent Cloud API. Built on a Mixture-of-Experts (MoE) architecture (406B total, 32B active parameters) and featuring a 256K context window, HY 2.0 Check out a comprehensive overview of the Tencent HY Model Family Moving forward, Tencent Hunyuan is now officially Tencent HY. Same powerful AI, a simpler name. Hunyuan3D Plugin is now FREE on Tencent Cloud ADP until Christmas.Let's build something awesome! Quote Tencent Cloud ADP @TencentCloudADP Dec 5 The Hunyuan 3D Plugin is now free on Tencent Cloud ADP until Christmas! We used to create 3D renders or design models that took hours of manual work. Now, with ADP + Hunyuan 3D, you can generate high-quality 3D models from a simple description or a single image. Tutorial Show more

items.title: ]( GPT-5.2 is now available for all Perplexity Pro and Max subscribers. ]( ]( Harvard and Perpl...
items.content: GPT-5.2 is now available for all Perplexity Pro and Max subscribers. Harvard and Perplexity researchers conducted the first largeâ€‘scale field study of how people use AI agents. We analyzed hundreds of millions of anonymized user interactions in Comet to answer three questions: whoâ€™s using agents, how much, and what for. Our findings show that professionals use the Comet Assistant to solve specific friction points in their industry. Finance professionals prioritize efficiency with 47% of queries on productivity, while students focus on utility, dedicating 43% to learning and research. AI agents are reshaping how we learn, work, and solve problems. Read the full research paper: Winners never stop learning. Never stop asking. #Ad Curiosity is a requirement for greatness. You win when you keep asking new questions every day. Thatâ€™s why I am proud to announce my investment in Perplexity. Perplexity is powering the worldâ€™s curiosity, and together we will inspire everyone to ask more ambitiou
